  • CodeSystem Omh Datapoint Type

    • This is the Continuous Integration Build of the Open mHealth to FHIR Implementation Guide, based on FHIR Version 3.0.1. See the Directory of published versions

    • Narrative Content
    • XML
    • JSON

    XML Format: CodeSystem-omh-datapoint-type

    Download Raw xml 

    
<CodeSystem xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
  <id value="omh-datapoint-type"/>
  <text>
    <status value="generated"/>
    <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><h2>Open mHealth to FHIR Datapoint Type</h2><div><p>OMH datapoint schema type the measure an Open mHealth data schema is representing.   These concepts are used were suitable LOINC or SNOMED-CT concepts are not available.</p>
</div><p>This code system http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/CodeSystem/omh-datapoint-type defines the following codes:</p><table class="codes"><tr><td style="white-space:nowrap"><b>Code</b></td><td><b>Display</b></td><td><b>Definition</b></td></tr><tr><td style="white-space:nowrap">geoposition<a name="omh-datapoint-type-geoposition"> </a></td><td>Geoposition</td><td>The latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location.  (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)</td></tr><tr><td style="white-space:nowrap">orientation<a name="omh-datapoint-type-orientation"> </a></td><td>Gyroscope measurement Panel</td><td>The latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location.  (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)</td></tr><tr><td style="white-space:nowrap">magnetic_force<a name="omh-datapoint-type-magnetic_force"> </a></td><td>Magnetic Force Panel</td><td>2 or 3 axis gyroscopic measurements representing the angular velocity in these axis.</td></tr><tr><td style="white-space:nowrap">pace<a name="omh-datapoint-type-pace"> </a></td><td>Pace</td><td>The time it takes to cover a certain distance (km or mile) by some physical activity like walking, running, biking, etc.  This is NOT the traditional unit of length of the same name.</td></tr></table></div>
  </text>
  <url value="http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/CodeSystem/omh-datapoint-type"/>
  <version value="0.0.0"/>
  <name value="omh-datapoint-type"/>
  <title value="Open mHealth to FHIR Datapoint Type"/>
  <status value="draft"/>
  <date value="2018-11-17T00:00:00-08:00"/>
  <contact>
    <telecom>
      <system value="url"/>
      <value value="http://www.openmhealth.org/"/>
    </telecom>
  </contact>
  <description
               value="OMH datapoint schema type the measure an Open mHealth data schema is representing.   These concepts are used were suitable LOINC or SNOMED-CT concepts are not available."/>
  <caseSensitive value="true"/>
  <valueSet value="http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/ValueSet/omh-datapoint-type"/>
  <content value="complete"/>
  <concept>
    <code value="geoposition"/>
    <display value="Geoposition"/>
    <definition
                value="The latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location.  (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)"/>
  </concept>
  <concept>
    <code value="orientation"/>
    <display value="Gyroscope measurement Panel"/>
    <definition
                value="The latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location.  (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)"/>
  </concept>
  <concept>
    <code value="magnetic_force"/>
    <display value="Magnetic Force Panel"/>
    <definition
                value="2 or 3 axis gyroscopic measurements representing the angular velocity in these axis."/>
  </concept>
  <concept>
    <code value="pace"/>
    <display value="Pace"/>
    <definition
                value="The time it takes to cover a certain distance (km or mile) by some physical activity like walking, running, biking, etc.  This is NOT the traditional unit of length of the same name."/>
  </concept>
</CodeSystem>
